means: （因人员过剩）被解雇的，失业的

sentence.Network_en: Changes in technology may mean that once-valued skills are now redundant.
sentence.Network_cn: 技术上的革新可能意味着曾经被重视的技术现在已变得多余。

sentence.Network_en: My husband was made redundant late last year.
sentence.Network_cn: 我丈夫去年年底被裁了。

sentence.Network_en: to be made redundant from your job

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (in the sense 'abundant'): from Latin redundant- 'surging up', from the verb redundare (see redound)

encyclopedia.content: Redundant 接口 备份接口。工作在CISCO的ASA产品上。把两个或多个物理接口逻辑为一个接口。若其中一接口DOWN掉，则有该redundant 组下的其他接口 继续转发流量，以达到冗余的作用，没有负载功能。 配置： interface Redundant1 member-interface GigabitEthernet0/0 member-interface GigabitEthernet0/1 Redundant 还是美国PUNK乐队GREEN DAY早期的一首歌曲

entry.tran: （人员因过剩）被解雇的，被裁减的
entry.def: If you are made redundant, your employer tells you to leave because your job is no longer necessary or because your employer cannot afford to keep paying you.

example.ex: My husband was made redundant late last year.
example.tran: 我丈夫去年年底被裁了。

entry.tran: 多余的；不再需要的；过剩的
entry.def: Something that is redundant is no longer needed because its job is being done by something else or because its job is no longer necessary or useful.

example.ex: Changes in technology may mean that once-valued skills are now redundant.
example.tran: 技术上的革新可能意味着曾经被重视的技术现在已变得多余。

example.ex: ...the conversion of redundant buildings to residential use.
example.tran: 将空置大楼改造为住宅

means.word_mean: 1. more than is needed, desired, or required;

sentences.sentence: "found some extra change lying on the dresser"
"yet another book on heraldry might be thought redundant"
"it was supererogatory of her to gloat"
"extra ribs as well as other supernumerary internal parts"

means.word_mean: 2. use of more words than required to express an idea;

sentences.sentence: "a wordy gossipy account of a simple incident"
"a redundant text crammed with amplifications of the obvious"

means.word_mean: 3. repetition of same sense in different words;

sentences.sentence: "`a true fact' and `a free gift' are pleonastic expressions"
"the phrase `a beginner who has just started' is tautological"
"at the risk of being redundant I return to my original proposition"- J.B.Conant

auth_sentence.content: His first step was to prune out redundant letters.
auth_sentence.res_content: His first step was to prune out redundant letters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His first step was to prune out redundant letters.

auth_sentence.content: This sounds impressive but turns out to be redundant.
auth_sentence.res_content: This sounds impressive but turns out to be redundant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This sounds impressive but turns out to be redundant.

auth_sentence.content: In the meantime, advise you to stay redundant.
auth_sentence.res_content: In the meantime, advise you to stay redundant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In the meantime, advise you to stay redundant.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 多余的,过剩的;[食物]丰富的;被解雇的
stems_affixes.word_buile: red反复+und波动+ant……的→反复波动→多余的
fec=fic做+und波动+ity表名词→出产的[粮食]像波浪→丰富,富饶
ab加强+und波动+ance表名词→[多得]像波浪一样→丰富
red回+ound=und波动→波动回来→回流,产生影响
ab加强+ound=und波动→[多得]像波浪一样→丰富
in进入+und波动+ate表动词→进入波浪,淹没

means.word_mean: 因人员过剩而被解雇的

sentences.en: Seventy men at the factory were redundant because of falling demand for our products.
sentences.cn: 由于对我们产品需求的减少, 工厂里有70人被辞退了。

sentences.en: There are too many redundant words in this book.
sentences.cn: 这本书里多余的词太多。

jushi.english: There are too many redundant words in this book.
jushi.chinese: 这本书里多余的词太多。

jushi.english: Seventy men at the factory were redundant because of falling demand for our products.
jushi.chinese: 由于对我们产品需求的减少,工厂里有70人被辞退了。

jushi.english: To keep the company alive half the workforce was redundant.
jushi.chinese: 为使公司生存下去，一半员工被解雇了。
